div1.p: Carter discusses a possible assignment to Hawaii to Laura Armistead Carter. He also encloses newspaper clippings and letters.

div1.head: Letter from Henry Rose Carter to Laura Armistead Carter, August 2, 1911
div1.opener:
Form 1765. Remember me kindly to Capt.
Mrs. Oliver to the Leys. TREASURY DEPARTMENT.
Aug 2/11 about 5. P.M.
Dear L.
div1.p:
Just a line to transmit these
clipps enclosures - 3 newspaper clippings enclosure 1 enclosure 2 enclosure 3 &
two letters-or rather a letter & apart of a letter.
I did not read Caldwell's clipping & the P.W. so
do not allude to it. Letter from H. today said
he was awfully home sick as he had been at
home about this time last year & had such a “thoroughly
satisfactory time.”

Glennan's letter don't say enough about the contempla-
ted detail to enable me to form a judgement
of its desireability. Whether it is very temporary
for some emergency - a - more or less lengthly the
latter most likely. Do not know if I would want its
under either condition. It Don't know if extra compen-
sation is attached probably not as the territory is poor.
The climate & living conditions of Hawaii are
said to be delightful- Calquhoun's paradise of
the Pacific & it would likely be a good
place for you, whether your mother & I are too old
to go to foreign parts may be a question. Still
we have very few afflications at any place in
the U. S. certainly at any to which I am liable
to go. Also Americans in foreign countries
where theyre are no great number of there
are usually very cordial. However the place
isn't offered yet.

Ned read very well last night & this mor
ning in all except same legal work of which
he had about 1¼ pages at he said 125 words
for me. He had 43¾ pages of general letters. He
should get through shortly.

The gladioli are, WONDERFUL those
last year were not in the same class.
Indeed my dear. The Irises, Roses & Gladioli have
been a very great pleasure this year al-
most as much a “Car-
Cossaine” at Costa
Rica was,
Harman is lying so
far as amount of in-
come is concerned al-
though he may be in
funds & even rich
Kate Lee was a nice girl
deserved a better father.
div1.closer:
Your affed'ate father H.R. Carter.
Form 1767.
TREASURY DEPARTMENT.

shoestrings
